thread.title: Bright and brisk Tuesday for the Hudson Valley
thread.title_full: Bright and brisk Tuesday for the Hudson Valley

author: News 12 Staff
title: Bright and brisk Tuesday for the Hudson Valley
text: News 12 Storm Watch Team Meteorologist Hope Osemwenkhae says it will be a bright and brisk Tuesday for the Hudson Valley. WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW: - No advisories at this time. - Partly cloudy and frigid overnight. Lows in the 20s. - Brighter, brisk and breezy on Tuesday. Highs in the 40s. Wind chills in the 20s and 30s. - Quiet and chilly through Wednesday. - Mostly cloudy, with a slight chance of rain/snow showers Thursday afternoon. Higher chance south of the area. - A bigger storm system could bring a greater chance for rain/ snow mix on Sunday. The News 12 Storm Watch Team is still tracking this system and will let you know the exact timing and impacts in the next few days. FORECAST OVERNIGHT: Partly cloudy and frigid. Lows near 26. TUESDAY: Very cold start, brighter, and brisk. Highs near 41. Lows near 30. WEDNESDAY: Sun and clouds, chilly, less breezy. Highs near 46. Lows near 32. THURSDAY: Partly sunny, chilly. Chance of a passing rain/snow shower. Highs near 41. Lows near 23. FRIDAY: Bitter cold. Brighter, breezy and colder. Highs near 37. Low of 25. SATURDAY: Partly sunny, chilly, breezy, chance of afternoon rain/snow mix. Highs near 40. Lows near 30. SUNDAY: Mostly cloudy, breezy, chance of rain/snow mix. Highs near 38. Lows near 31. MONDAY: Mostly sunny with a brisk breeze. Highs near 37. Lows near 26.

organizations.name: hudson valley news 12 storm watch team meteorologist hope osemwenkhae
